name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Turtle Brook Inn

reviews.text: Excellent choice. buffet breakfast. coffee/tea, bagles,facilities on tap 24/7.as well as coffee maker in room. Room spacious with 2 double beds. Open plan breakfast room leading from reception which can also be used as a kitchen at night with a microwave available. Internet station(2 computers) available at no extra charge which was a bonus to us. Staff very friendly & courteous and none more so than the proprietors Brian & Paula who went out of their way to help two Irish guys. We stayed 5 days and have to say
reviews.title: home away from home

reviews.text: our business was quite stressful but this hotel was so laid back we really didn't notice.
reviews.title: Tasteful and accommodating

reviews.text: NewYork express bus stops right outside for a 40 min ride to the "Big Apple" if you don't wish to be in the middle of the ' hustle&bustle ' (unfortunately we didn't get to sample it on this occasion). For those who have kids,the hotel is located directly across the road from a zoo. All in all we had a terrific stay and it was the first time in all the hotels we've stayed in that we got a "hug " from the owner on departure !
reviews.title: I'd stay there again!"

reviews.text: The room was tastefully decorated, clean and quiet. Great, comfortable beds. Everything in the room worked fine. Plenty of towels, etc.. Breakfast options were plentiful and varied, though that experience could be further enhanced by tuning out the Fox News channel. Staff was helpful and friendly. Convenient location. Definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, great beds ,friendly staff. two thumbs up!
Not Clean - Bad Experience
reviews.text: I would definitely stay there again. My wife was at a conference at Seton Hall so I and my 6 month old daughter spent most of the week at the hotel. The staff was very friendly. We felt very safe there as this was our first stay in this part of New Jersey. The breakfast was continental and good. The bagels were great. You can make your own waffles on their griddle. We got a discount since we were doing something with Seton Hall University.

The place is basically a motel that's got a new coat of paint and a new carpet. The rooms smell a little funky but you get used to it after awhile. The breakfast area is fine (bagels, waffles). There was no orange juice left when we went down to eat, and the FOX News blasting throughout the breakfast area. The fitness center has some machines but they're hard to figure out and the room is tiny. Basically, it seems that the place did the minimum to become a Best Western affiliate. If you have to stay here, I'd say it's fine. But I might check out some alternatives first.
reviews.title: Mediocre at best

reviews.text: I got stuck in Newark when they canceled all flights because of weather in the area. Immediately, all hotels were booked full and I was barely able to get a room at this hotel through Expedia. Having never heard of the place, I braced myself for the worst. However, I was very pleasantly surprised when we arrived after a 7 mile / 20minute drive taxi drive from the airport. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are fairly large, clear with decent attention to detail, and the breakfast was more than adequate. This is not a 5 star hotel, but for the type of hotel class it does a very nice job and i would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: This is an old-style but renovated two-floor motel...dated but clean and a good value. My kingsize room was large, with a very comfortable bed, comfy chairs, roomy desk, and a large TV. The bathroom was basic, with soap, shampoo and lotion. Appreciated the nightlight. Everything in the room worked. There is a small fitness center where I used the treadmill and TV, but couldn't get the other equipment to function. There were complimentary fresh towels and bottled water there as well.The inn provides a complimentary 'continental' buffet breakfast which was surprisingly good and varied (muffins, toast, waffles, cold cereals, hard-cooked eggs, juices, etc.), and the food area was spotless and well-stocked with an alert attendant constantly on the scene. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Only a couple of downsides: there is no elevator (though they did offer to help take luggage to the second floor), and my in-room safe was located on a high shelf in the closet, totally inaccessible as the closet doors do not open fully. All said, I will definitely return whenever I'm in the area on business.
reviews.title: Good value/Friendly staff
